I am going to hold off posting until I get some feedback, but as the thread states, do you really trust any politician.

post_info.post_title: Do you really trust any politician

gansao

If you do not trust your own politicians in the states you should see the ones we have in the UK! You have never seen a worse bunch of stupid, corrupt freeloaders in your life and they are the better ones!
 No I do not trust politicians! The only one I remotely trust is my own member of Parliament ( luckily enough) because he is a maverick.

If you do not trust your own politicians in the states you should see the ones we have in the UK! You have never seen a worse bunch of stupid, corrupt freeloaders in your life and they are the better ones!
 No I do not trust politicians! The only one I remotely trust is my own member of Parliament ( luckily enough) because he is a maverick.

 
 He may be a maverick, but I guarantee you he has done something that would benefit him at some point in his tenure.
gansao

He may be a maverick, but I guarantee you he has done something that would benefit him at some point in his tenure.

 
 
 He gave his son a well paid job that he was not entitled to do.
 He is a blatant self promoter and chancer but he works seven days a week( I sent an email to him on a Sunday and recieved a reply the same day!) and you can call him on his mobile ( cell phone ) anytime. He might not answer though. Thats my kind of politician!
Ethmi

Besides wasting taxpayer's money (I'm sure an average person would do this just as quickly if given the opportunity), a politician does nothing worse than an average person; it's just capitalized more. People ridiculed and screamed that Palin's 17 year old daughter was pregnant and that Bill was with Monica. But really, it's not like she's the first 17 year old in the history of the world to get pregnant, and it's not like Clinton was the first guy on earth to cheat on his wife either. It just made a better story in the paper.
Jo Bennett
I generally trust Green Party politicians, because if you're out for personal gain you wouldn't join the Greens. I trust Tony Benn most of the time.
Big_Bear_Scot

I generally trust Green Party politicians, because if you're out for personal gain you wouldn't join the Greens. I trust Tony Benn most of the time.

 
 I trust Alex Salmond a great deal, I think he is excellent Politician who seems to always fight for the Scottish people. Also think Tony Benn was a guy to be trusted pity he isn't Parliament anymore.
grizzly6626

I think all politicians are crooks, some worse than others, and they should all be replaced by working class folks who genuinely care about their fellow man. Also working class people are more in touch with the issues that we all face everyday, as it affects them more than the upperclass are affected.
Jo Bennett

I think all politicians are crooks, some worse than others, and they should all be replaced by working class folks who genuinely care about their fellow man. Also working class people are more in touch with the issues that we all face everyday, as it affects them more than the upperclass are affected.

 
 Thing is, even working class people can be awful in government. Take Alan Johnson, who was UK education secretary despite not having had an education to speak of himself, and as unpleasant as politicians come. Compare to Tony Benn, the peer who renounced his peerage in order to continue representing his constituents in the commons.
gansao

Take Alan Johnson, who was UK education secretary despite not having had an education to speak of himself, and as unpleasant as politicians come. Compare to Tony Benn, the peer who renounced his peerage in order to continue representing his constituents in the commons.

 
 Tony Benn was a great character but not a great politician
grizzly6626

I cant speculate on politicians outside of America, but for us, we need to look to the past to have a better tomorrow. Now I know that America is a lot different today than it was 200 years ago, its even a lot different than it was fifty years ago, and a lot of folks say what worked then will not work today, but I believe the principles will still work today. People today have somehow lost themselves, many people have the attitude that they only care about today, and as long as things are ok right now, then why worry about tomorrow. We have misplaced our morals, as we have misplaced our self respect and dignities. We started believing things are right, when in reality they are wrong. Weather you believe in God or not, you must still admit that before God was basically removed from schools and many homes, kids were a lot more behaved and respectful, and back then you could spank your child as a disciplinary action, and I dont mean beat your kids, there is a difference. I was spanked as a kid when I screwed up, but I was never beaten and I didnt develope a complex from it as some would have us to believe. All I am saying is that everyone, not just our politicians, needs to get back to doing what is right, instead of what is easy and socially acceptable, and our leaders need to do just that, lead, lead by example. I am what some refer to as a unconformist, I conform only to the law, but nothing else unless I believe it to be true and moral.
gansao

'All I am saying is that everyone, not just our politicians, needs to get back to doing what is right, instead of what is easy and socially acceptable.'
 
 Well said mate!
jitobear

I think most politicians start out as sincere, honest people who want to serve. But once you get elected to office you have power, and even more powerful/wealthy people whispering in your ear, and a million opinions to try and appease, and people will always find a way to villify any action you take. Politics are messy and I think its hard to get elected not get jaded and corrupted. 
 
 So do I trust them? No, not so much.
Ethmi
A cantidate will always do wonders for the economy and society and all that until he gets elected.
